posts.title: Care and Feeding of Mobile Devices
posts.text: Care and Feeding of Mobile Devices Mobile Device SecurityObjective 2.8 Given a scenario, implement methods for securing mobile devices Objective term Screen Lock Face recognition Multi-factor authentication Authenticator apps Locator apps Erase device Mobile Device Management Screen locks prevent others form accessing your phone and use fingerprints, pin codes, passwords, or facial recognition Multifactor authentication means to use more than one way to authenticate Authenticator apps add an extra layer of security Location apps like FInd my Phone help locate lost devices
posts.author: Xin Nie

posts.title: Portable Computing
posts.text: Portable Computing Power ManagementObjective 1.6 Given a scenario, use Microsoft Windows Control Panel utilities Objective term AC Adapter - Vendor-specific power ports ACPI - Advanced Configuration and Power Interface ACPI level 0 - Power is on ACPI level 3 - Sleep mode ACPI level 4 - Hibernation mode All OS provide power management utilities
posts.author: Xin Nie

posts.title: The Internet
posts.text: The Internet Objective 4.9 Given a scenario, use remote access technologies Telnet and SSH Objective Term: Telnet - Port 23 Secure Shell (SSH) - port 22 The Telnet and the Secure Shell (SSH) protocols provide command line access to remove systems Telnet runs on TCP port 23; SSH runs on TCP port 22 Telnet is unencrypted; SSH is encrypted Remote Desktop Connections Objective Term: Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) - Port 3389 Virtual Network Computing (VNC) - Port 5900+N Windows uses Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) for remote connectivity Use Virtual Network Computing (VNC) protocol for connecting to Linux and Mac systems Try Tight VNC to use VNC from a Windows system The World Wide WebObjective 2.2 Explain logical security concepts Objective Term: HTTP - port 80 (insecure) HTTPS - port 443 (encrypts everything) Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) Transport Layer Security (TLS) The World Wide Web uses either the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or HTTP Secure (HTTPS) protocols HTTP uses port 80 and is not secure HTTPS uses port 443 and uses certificates to make a secure connection Make sure to recognize typical certificate errors Troubleshooting Internet ConnectionsObjective 1.4 Given a scenario, use appropriate Microsoft command line tools Check your physical system first Know your network ipconfig/all Know your network connectivity tracert(Win), traceroute(Linux/Mac) ping
posts.author: Xin Nie

posts.title: Wireless Networking
posts.text: Wireless Networking Objective 2.3 Compare and contrast wireless security protocols and authentication methods Wireless Encryption Objective Term: WEP (Wired Equivalent Privacy) TKIP (Temporal Key Integrity Protocol) AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) WPA (Wi-Fi Protected Access) WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup) The obsolete WEP encryption is easily cracked today and is never used WPA introduced TKIP-personal shared key and RADIUS authentication WPA2 added AES encryption WPS automates encryption, but is easily crackable Enterprise Wireless Object Term: Power over Ethernet (PoE) PoE (1st generation) and PoE+ PoE injector AAA - authorization, authentication, accounting RADIUS or TACACS+ Extended SSID (ESSID) Enterprise WAPs often use Power over Ethernet (PoE) Use powerful wireless analysis tools to determine WAP location Enterprise networks often use RADIUS or TACACS+ protocols for authentication Two or more WAPs sharing the same SSID are known as ESSIDs
posts.author: Xin Nie

posts.title: Port Forwarding
posts.text: Port Forwarding A port forward is when a NAT router opens incoming traffic on a certain port access to a single system on the internal network You configure port forwarding on the NAT router We often use nonstandard port numbers for security reasons We use Dynamic DNS to give DNS names to port forwarded devices
posts.author: Xin Nie

posts.title: Windows Firewall
posts.text: Windows Firewall Host Firewall Host firewall is an individual firewall. Windows Defender Firewall is a host-based firewall that comes with Windows Host firewalls protect systems using host features such as file names or process IDs Windows defender firewall has three settings: Domain network Private network Guest or public network Network discovery & exception You can create exceptions manually if needed
posts.author: Xin Nie

posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
